You will report to the CEO and work closely with the other Managing Directors as well as other stakeholders within Akind Group.
 



  





**Some examples of your primary work responsibilities are:** 



* Continue to develop and grow a profitable business with loyal and engaged co-workers
* Ensure that relevant goals and ambitious targets are set, as well as follow-up and take actions on KPI:s to reach the goals and targets
* Be a role model in living by Crowd Collective´s core values and contribute culturally in building the best place to work
* Ensure that the business you lead takes part of best practice sharing within the Group
* Maintain a strong cooperation and communication within both Crowd Collective Group and Akind Group
* Ensure succession within Crowd Collective Stockholm and Crowd Collective Sweden
* Together with the Crowd Collective Group Management evaluate and elaborate the business strategy and business plan for the Group
* Report results on a regular basis to CEO



  





**Who you are** 




 To thrive in this position, you are convinced that a company´s success starts with the people. As a leader, you are including, perceptive and warm. You listen and want to understand before you act and won’t hesitate to dig in yourself when needed, helping your Crowds with whatever is needed at the moment. You keep a positive mindset through ups and downs and can be the rock for your team to lean on. We also expect you to possess the ability to convey information with clarity, keeping others informed and giving constructive feedback.
 



  





 You are experienced and passionate about sales and know what it takes to reach ambitious targets in a structured and strategic way.
 



  





 We believe you see the greatness in running an entrepreneurial business in an exciting scale up phase and at the same time belong to a larger context with a well-established corporate group providing resources, support, and stability.
 



  





**Requirements for this role is:** 



* Experience working with sales in IT-consultancy business
* Leadership experience with well documented results of high employee engagement
* Familiar with the target group of tech professionals and knowledge of how to attract, develop and keep this competence
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken alike
* Academic degree within relevant field



  





**It will be considered highly qualifying if you have:** 



* Experience from strongly contributing to or leading company growth
* Experience from a role with P&L responsibility



  





**About the Company** 




 Crowd Collective Stockholm, started in 2017, and currently consists of 50 employees. All together in Crowd Collective Group we are 140 employees and growing every day. Crowd Collective is part of Akind, a network designed to make people and businesses grow. Besides Crowd Collective, Akind Group consists of Academic Work, Brights Learning and Winona.
 *Find out more about Crowd Collective and what it’s like to work with us at* 
***www.crowdcollective.com***
*‍* 




  





**Practical info** 




 Place of employment: Akind Building, Hagastaden
 



 Extent: Full time
 



 Start date: ASAP, with regard to notice period
 



  





 In this process Crowd Collective is working together with Winona. If you have any questions, please contact Recruitment Responsible: Linda Lundgren at linda.lundgren@winonagroup.com
 



 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.

title: Threat Intelligence Specialist
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Do you love being a champion and advocating for breaking down complex cybersecurity concepts and threats in a way that is accessible to non-security professionals, including developers, product managers, and business leaders? We are committed to ensuring the security and privacy of our customers' data and that is at the forefront of our service. We are looking for a Threat Intelligence Specialist to help us maintain the highest security standards across our service offering.
   

  

 We are launching an exciting DevOps initiative that aims to overhaul the way we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. Our goal is twofold: To thrill our customers by delivering services they love and giving them a competitive edge, while building a “lean and mean” product development organization which will allow Ericsson to scale at profit.
   

  

 You will be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You will be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

 If you're passionate about fostering modern security practices into product development paradigms, driving change, shaping cutting-edge technology to deliver customer value, and you get a kick about building something entirely new, we want you on board!
   

  

**Why join Solution Area Sapper**
 Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) continues to evolve cloud native portfolio as well as explores new ways of building solutions, including enabling cloud native “as a Service” offerings. Newly established Sapper unit will ensure BCSS readiness for “as a Service” when our customers start shifting towards new networks operations models that could truly leverage the opportunities and agility cloud native deployment brings. We have chosen less traditional name for our newly acceleration unit to signal that this unit will operate differently. The name Sapper originates from a soldier that performs challenging tasks that require engineering skills, a pioneer with deep technical understanding.
   

  

 With us, you will have an outstanding opportunity: The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what is possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.
   

  

**Why join our team**
 We are building a dream team, and this is what we are after:
   

  

* Innovative atmosphere. Be part of a creative, forward-thinking team dedicated to revolutionizing the way we do software.
* Collaborative culture. Work alongside talented professionals who share your passion for technology and community building.
* Strong sense of purpose and high impact. Contribute to shaping the future of our products and directly impact the experience of developers across our global company.
* Psychological safety. An environment where team members feel comfortable taking risks, voicing their ideas and admitting mistakes without fear of negative repercussions.
* Career growth. We invest in your development, offering opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
* Endless possibilities. Your ideas and innovations won’t just be heard – they’ll be the driving force behind our success.


**What You Will Do**
 You will lead the way. As a Threat Intelligence Specialist you will be part of a security team and you will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and communicating cyber threats that could impact our services. You will monitor and assess various threat intelligence feeds, conduct in-depth analysis of potential security threats, and provide actionable insights to help enhance our security posture. Your role is crucial in enabling proactive defense strategies and ensuring that Sapper stays ahead of emerging threats.
   

  

* Continuously monitor threat intelligence feeds, cybersecurity news, and dark web sources to identify emerging threats relevant to the organization.
* Analyze and interpret data from various sources to understand the tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) of potential attackers.
* Collaborate with the SRE team to provide context and insights during security incidents, helping to identify the threat actors and potential impacts.
* Produce detailed threat intelligence reports, including risk assessments and recommendations for mitigating threats.
* Develop profiles of cyber threat actors, including their motivations, capabilities, and the specific threats they pose to the organization.
* Provide actionable recommendations based on threat intelligence to improve security controls, policies, and procedures.
* Work closely with other security teams, such as the SRE, other Ericsson Red Team, and Vulnerability Management, to ensure threat intelligence is integrated into our processes.
* Utilize and enhance threat intelligence platforms (TIPs) and automation tools to streamline the collection, analysis, and dissemination of threat data.
* Educate and inform stakeholders across the organization about emerging threats and how to defend against them through presentations, briefings, and written communications.
* Provide guidance and training to Dev(Sec)Ops teams on security best practices.
* Evaluate and recommend security tools, technologies, and services to enhance the security posture of the service offering.


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience as a Threat Intelligence Specialist, preferably in cloud-native Dev(Sec)Ops environments.
* Strong understanding of cyber threat landscapes, including knowledge of advanced persistent threats (APTs), malware, phishing, and other attack vectors.
* Experience working with threat intelligence platforms and analyzing threat data.
* Proficiency in analyzing TTPs and using frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK.
* Experience with tools such as SIEMs, TIPs, and network traffic analysis tools.
* Experience with cloud security on hyper scale cloud providers , GCP, Azure or AWS.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to inspire and guide DevOps teams effectively.
* Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities in the context of cybersecurity challenges.
* Be collaborative and curious, able to work with all levels of staff with outstanding relationship building and influencing skills.
* Strong ability to lead and execute on the strategy to scale the security and privacy work across the organization, and not just execute on the deliverables.
* Passion for lean thinking approaches, automation, and continuous everything with a focus on scalability of software deliverables and of teams/people.


**What We Offer**
* Flexible hybrid work environment. A hybrid workspace enables us to get the best out of both worlds – in person team building opportunities at our modern and flexible offices, as well as the ability to work from home in a setup tailored to your needs. We do foresee favoring a balance of more in-person team time over remote work as we build our organization and teams and get to know each other as teammates, a 3/2 model.
* Wellbeing support. Access healthcare benefits, mental health resources, and wellness programs, ensuring your holistic wellbeing.
* Continuous learning. Invest in your growth with opportunities for skill enhancement, including workshops, conferences, and certifications.
* Team unity. Build lasting connections through team-building events, collaborative projects, and shared victories.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 753706
   

  

 ]]>

title: Senior Management Consultant
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**The Team:**
 As a Senior Value Consultant you'll be joining our Nordics Value Engineering function, based in Copenhagen. This function is part of the wider Value Engineering organisation at Celonis. The position of Value Engineer is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Execution Management System. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.
   

  

**The Role:**
 As a Senior Value Consultant you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
**Identify & Frame Value**
* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**
* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**
* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**
* Live for Customer Value: Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis / analytics, business process improvement and respective Software deployment . Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Software provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise
* Data, Analytics, Applications & IT: Good knowledge of Business Software applications and experience in using and/ or building dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Experience in collaborating with IT teams Process Improvement & Value Realization: Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
* Project Management: Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible
* Executive Stakeholder Management: Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and Danish
* Business Domain Expertise: Deep understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* Industry Expertise: Expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
* Degree: in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


**What Celonis can offer you:**
* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


**About Us**
 Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

 Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.
   

  

 Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.
   

  

 Accessibility and Candidate Notices

title: Manager - Industrial Engineering
description:
The project to implement Scania's first battery factory is in full swing and we in the engineering team are looking to reinforce our organization to be able to take on all the exciting challenges in battery production while looking ahead to a future with new projects. This creates the need of more experienced leaders to drive the introduction of our new organization.
   

  

 If you are an experienced group manager, ready for a new challenge and feel that it would be exciting to be part of the journey ahead, then you are most welcome to apply to us.
   

  

**Your profile:**
* As a leader, you are open and communicative.
* You include your employees in decisions and work actively with feedback to create conditions for your employees to grow in their roles and towards our common goal of creating the world's best battery factory!
* You are driven and committed and create trusting relationships both within your own organization and outside.
* You have very good analytical skills. You are interested in technology and can easily familiarize yourself with details while having an understanding of the whole.
* As a manager, you are responsible in ensuring that your employees have the conditions in place to create good results at the right time. You work independently but ask for support and help when needed.
* You have most likely a degree from university/college, have experience from engineering and have worked as an engineering manager for at least 2-3 years.


**Your work assignment:**
 You are the responsible manager of a group consisting of project managers, industrial engineers and other specialists in the industrial engineering field. We work according to Scania's methods with focus on ensuring safety, quality and productivity. Part of the assignment is part of Traton's common product strategy and we therefore work on a regular basis with our colleagues within the group.
   

  

 You are part of a team of managers who jointly develop our way of working, together with our employees. We work cross-functionally to ensure standardized work across the entire Engineering organization and we would like to have diversity in our team.
   

  

 You are fluent in both Swedish and English language.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Please get in touch if you have questions or if you are curious to hear more about the role.
   

  

 Roger Pavón, Engineering Workshop Manager
   

  

 Battery Production/Investment projects, roger.pavon@scania.com
   

  

**Application:**
 The application must contain a CV, personal letter and copies of grades. We apply tests as part of the recruitment process. A background check may be conducted for the position. Apply through Scania's website no later than 2024-07-31
   

  

 Welcome with your application!

title: Areaarkitekt
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Utforma och integrera tekniska lösningar över olika system och produktområden
* Följa och främja arkitekturprinciper och riktlinjer inom sitt ansvarsområde
* Leda tekniska analyser för att identifiera och utvärdera alternativa lösningar, risker och möjligheter


 Är du nyfiken på hur den här texten ska sluta? Kul! Vi gillar dig redan. Att vara nyfiken är viktigt för oss.
   

  

 På SBAB spelar nämligen rollen mindre roll. Att du är kunnig förväntar vi oss. Det viktiga är att du vill vara med och bidra till vår kultur, attityd och vårt sätt att vara. Och eftersom vi är lika många experter som medarbetare, behöver alla vara just nyfikna och intresserade av varandras olikheter. Vi lyssnar in och omvärderar kontinuerligt. Vi tror på mångfald, att olika perspektiv berikar och att du är en viktig framgångsfaktor. Fortfarande nyfiken? Välkommen!
   

  

 Att jobba som Areaarkitekt
   

  

 SBAB Tech spelar en central roll inom SBAB genom att ansvara för drift, utveckling, förvaltning, underhåll och support av alla koncernens IT-system. Du som Areaarkitekt kommer att vara en del av vår Arkitekturgrupp som är dedikerad till att utveckla och förvalta företagets arkitektur för att fullt ut stödja SBAB:s strategiska mål och visioner.
   

  

 Som Arearkitekt på SBAB Tech kommer du att bidra med att leda tekniska analyser för att identifiera och utvärdera alternativa lösningar, risker och möjligheter, samt bedöma påverkan och kostnad. Du kommer också att övervaka och balansera kvalitetsattribut i förhållande till funktionskrav för att underlätta prioriteringar och beslutsfattande. Följa och främja arkitekturprinciper och riktlinjer inom sitt ansvarsområde för att maximera återanvändning av befintlig funktionalitet. Vidare kommer du att proaktivt samla in och implementera insikter för arkitektoniska förbättringar inom organisationen. Du kommer att arbeta nära andra arkitekter för att justera och förbättra våra arkitektoniska processer och metoder. Vägleda och stödja team för att säkerställa en enhetlig teknisk förståelse och bidra till en mogen arkitekturkultur.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren Areaarkitekt med kompetens att genomföra arkitekturgranskningar och säkerställa att lösningens kvalitetsattribut är i linje med de funktionella kraven. Du har en stark förmåga att säkerställa spårbarhet mellan lösningskrav och verksamhetsbehov samt skicklighet i att utforma helhetslösningar med tydliga arkitekturella vyer och integrationer. Du bidrar med expertis i att utveckla konceptuella tekniska lösningar. Med din drivkraft strävar du alltid efter bättre lösningar. Du har en förmåga att utföra djupgående tekniska analyser och skapa robusta beslutsunderlag. Vi ser gärna att du är erfaren inom IT-arkitektur, med en god förståelse för både tekniska och affärsmässiga aspekter.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Målinriktad
* Självgående
* Lagspelare
* Nyfiken
* Analytisk


 Annars då?
   

  

 Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

title: Projektledare - ERP
description:
**Vill du ta dig an utvecklande uppdrag tillsammans med branschens mest erfarna?** 




  





 Midagon är en stabil, växande koncern med mångåriga kundrelationer. Vi är över 200 konsulter i Norden, varav cirka 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer.
 



  





 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom bland annat projektledning, verksamhetsutveckling eller specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), certifierade av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Vill du också vara del av ett team av seniora experter, där avslappnad atmosfär går hand i hand med ett engagerat arbete och sund livsbalans?
 



  





**Rollen** 




 Vi letar nu efter fler konsulter med erfarenhet som seniora program- och projektledare.
 



 I rollen driver du utmanande transformationsprojekt tillsammans med våra projektledare och verksamhetsutvecklare. Du arbetar jämsides med kunden i deras förändringsresor från tidig projektstart, implementering till överlämning.
 



  





 För trivas hos oss krävs i rollen en kombination av entusiasm, pragmatism samt ett metodist tillvägagångssätt. Både ledarskaps- och projektledningserfarenhet är avgörande, liksom färdigheter inom förändringsledning.
 



  





**För att bli framgångsrik i rollen bör du ha:** 




 Har lett projekt inom affärs- och IT-transformationer, inklusive men inte begränsat till ERP-program, M&A, verksamhetsarkitektur eller industriella digitaliseringsprojekt.
 



  





 · Är insatt i ledande ERP-system som SAP, M3 eller Dynamics
 



 · Förenar affärs- och teknisk kunskap, särskilt när det kommer till centrala affärsprocesser inom ekonomi eller tillverkning
 



 · Kan uppvisa utmärkt ledarskap och gedigen projektledningserfarenhet
 



 · Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska
 



  





 Om du brinner för ständig förändring, älskar att ta dig an komplexa utmaningar och genuint vill hjälpa kunder att realisera sina mål, då kan du vara rätt person för oss.
 



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs gärna mer på www.midagon.com där du också enkelt registrerar din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Martin på martin.nilsson@midagon.com eller 070–2257833.
 



  





 Välkommen till oss!

title: Senior Internal Auditor at Scania Group
Uppsatspraktik i Stockholm 2025
description:
**Om oss**
 Linklaters är en internationell ledande affärsjuridisk advokatbyrå med huvudkontor i London. Med över 5600 anställda och 31 kontor är vi etablerade i alla stora affärs- och finanscentra och kan erbjuda våra klienter förstklassig juridisk rådgivning världen över.
   

  

 Vårt Stockholmskontor fokuserar på komplex transaktionsrådgivning inom M&A, Private Equity och Banking & Finance och arbetar integrerat med Linklaters övriga kontor världen över. Hos oss utvecklar du din affärsjuridiska kompetens och bygger ett starkt lokalt och internationellt nätverk, samtidigt som du bistår våra klienter i deras mest komplexa transaktioner och ärenden. Läs mer om Linklaters på www.linklaters.com.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som läser juristprogrammet och som önskar skriva uppsatspraktik under 2025. Vi söker dig som som har goda akademiska meriter och som vill arbeta i team på en internationell byrå med tydligt transaktionsfokus. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Servicekänsla, noggrannhet och god analytisk förmåga är också av stor vikt. Du är en positiv och öppen person som är intresserad av att lära dig och av att bidra till både verksamhetens och din personliga utveckling.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Du erbjuds en spännande praktik på en internationell ledande advokatbyrå där det finns stora möjligheter till utveckling. Du får dagligen arbeta i en internationell miljö med topprankade jurister och marknadens mest komplexa ärenden, både i Stockholm och runt om i världen.
   

  

 Praktikperioden på ca 4–12 veckor utformas individuellt för att passa dig och kan göras i samband med uppsatsskrivning alternativt inom ramen för en fördjupningskurs. Under din praktikperiod blir du en del av arbetsteamet och den dagliga verksamheten. Det är en fantastisk möjlighet att få testa på hur det är att praktiskt arbeta med internationell affärsjuridik och klienter, samt möjliggör en vidareutveckling av dina juridiska kunskaper. Du får en handledare som vägleder och stöttar dig under din praktik och som hjälper dig att utvecklas. Du får även ta del av vårt omfattande bibliotek och databaser.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 För att söka praktik skickar du in CV, personliga brev och resultatintyg. Vi rekryterar löpande.
 *På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.*
 För frågor om praktikplats är du välkommen att kontakta Marie Lundqvist, HR Advisor. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Technical Skills**
**This list of duties and responsibilities above is not exhaustive. It is intended to describe the general content of, and requirements for, the performance of this job. As such, the role may also include the undertaking of additional tasks as required.**

title: Internetinhämtare till Regionalt it-brottscentrum
description:
Vill du vara med och använda avancerad teknik för att avslöja brott och skydda samhället?
   

  

 Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

*Vi söker en engagerad och skicklig individ med passion för Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) för att stärka vårt team i kampen mot brottslighet. OSINT handlar om att samla och analysera information från öppna och tillgängliga källor på nätet och andra offentliga plattformar för att få en djupare förståelse för aktuella hot och mönster. Genom att använda dessa verktyg kan vi upptäcka och förebygga kriminella aktiviteter innan de inträffar, och därigenom bidra till ett säkrare samhälle.*
 Vi jobbar med att avslöja och identifiera de osynliga som gömmer sig på olika delar av internet. Vi jobbar med komplexa händelser och grova brott i region Stockholm. Medarbetarna beskriver jobbet som värdefullt jobb inom polismyndigheten som är på framfart inom digital bevissäkring och jobbet ger ”kickar” av att vara med där det händer.
   

  

*Som en del av vårt team kommer du att använda OSINT för att spåra och identifiera misstänkta individer, analysera deras nätverk och beteenden, samt bistå med värdefulla insikter i utredningar och brottsbekämpning. Om du är en analytisk tänkare med en förmåga att se mönster i data och är redo att använda din expertis för att göra en verklig skillnad, då är det här din chans att bidra till ett tryggare samhälle.*
 Om oss
   

  

 Är du redo för en större uppgift? Till vår utredningsenhet söker vi till Internetinhämtningen personer som är strukturerade, kreativa och professionella. Hos oss kommer du tillsammans med engagerade och trevliga kollegor utvecklas och få erfarenheter för livet, samtidigt som ditt arbete bidrar till att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i Sverige.
   

  

 Vid region Stockholms utredningsenhet finns sektionen Regionalt IT-brottscentrum 1.
   

  

 En biträdessektion som verkar inom flera olika kompetensområden, alla med fokus på att bidra till regionens utredningsverksamhet. Uppdragen är främst inom områdena: it-forensik, internetinhämtning samt analys av transaktioner med kryptovalutor. Sektionen har även ett uppdrag att bidra till kompetenshöjningen av utredningsverksamheten avseende it-relaterad brottslighet över hela regionen.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten, region Stockholm har ca 6 680 anställda. Regionen består av fyra polisområden inklusive Gotland, regionala enheter samt ett regionkansli som lyder direkt under regionpolischefen. Operativa enhetens uppdrag är att aktivt stödja lokalpolisområden, polisområden och enheter i sitt grunduppdrag. Detta gör vi genom att utveckla och tillhandahålla specialistförmåga som höjer den operativa effekten i arbetet med regionens problembild. Med specialistkompetens, hög service och god samverkan är operativa enheten en viktig del i det operativa och brottsbekämpande arbetet i Polisregion Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med och bygga Regionalt it-brottscentrum Stockholms förmåga inom den skyddade internetinhämtningen.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 Som internetinhämtare på Polismyndigheten är dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter att bevissäkra, bearbeta, analysera och protokollföra inhämtat material från internet inom ramen för pågående förundersökning. Arbetet kan ske individuellt eller i utredningsteam. Ditt uppdrag kommer vara att bistå med kompetens gällande digital bevisning på internet och sociala medier, främst i grova brott som sker i region Stockholm.
   

  

 Du kommer att få medverka vid teknik- och metodutveckling inom området i region Stockholm, men också nationellt. Samverkan med andra polisregioner, avdelningar, myndigheter och externa organisationer både nationellt och internationellt förekommer.
   

  

 Verksamheten präglas av högt säkerhetsmedvetande och med hög rättssäkerhet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* Gymnasieutbildning, polisexamen eller annan arbetserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant för tjänsten
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning inom nätverksteknik, systemvetenskap/IT, informationssäkerhet eller relevant utbildning inom IT, cybersäkerhet, högskoleutbildning eller fristående kurser som bedöms relevant för tjänsten
* Dokumenterade programmeringskunskaper, främst Python eller Javascript
* Erfarenhet av OSINT-arbete
* Utredningsvana eller underrättelsearbete hos rättsvårdande myndighet eller motsvarande
* Van användare av internet och sociala medier samt har god kunskap om internets uppbyggnad och funktionalitet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med analyseringsverktyg och visualiseringsverktyg
* Vana att hantera stora informationsmängder och visualisera en strukturerad rapport av informationen samt presentera resultatet
* Kunskap om DNS/Internetinfrastruktur
* Kunskap om IP-adresser och IP-adressers betydelse för internet
* B-körkort


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna ställer krav på hög integritet, det är därför viktigt med ett högt sekretessmedvetande. Som person har du fallenhet för att fånga upp detaljer och se samband. Du är flexibel och har lätt för att arbeta både enskilt och i grupp och bidrar till gruppens utveckling genom engagemang och prestigelöshet. Du är uthållig, noggrann, självgående och initiativrik.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har ett utvecklande och nyfiket angreppssätt på dina arbetsuppgifter. Då en stor del av arbetet präglas av samarbete och kontakter både internt och externt kommer stor vikt att läggas vid dina personliga egenskaper och samarbetsförmåga. Du ska ha stort engagemang och vilja att utveckla och driva verksamheten framåt.
   

  

**I samband med rekryteringen kommer teoretiskt och praktiskt test att användas.**
 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef
   

  

 Daniel Andersson, 010-56 366 24
   

  

 Saskia Handberg, vid frågor som berör rekryteringsprocessen
   

  

 Saskia.handberg@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 SACO, Fackförbundet ST, SEKO Polisen, nås via polisens växel 114 14.
   

  

 Mats Johansson, Polisförbundet, nås via 114 14.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Arbetsort: Södermalm, Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Flexibel arbetstid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Inhämtare internet
   

  

 I denna roll ingår beredskapstjänstgöring. Under beredskapen jobbar man ordinarie arbetstid under dagtid, men har under sin beredskapsvecka skyldighet att vara anträffbar och tillgänglig under kväll och natt. Du kan bli ombedd att omedelbart närvara på arbetsplatsen eller utföra arbetsuppgifter. Normalt är att man har beredskap var sjätte vecka.
   

  

 Från och med maj 2024 använder vi inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringsprocesser. Utöver CV behöver du även besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor som en del av din ansökan. Dessa frågor utgår från aktuell kravprofil och ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och svar på frågor nedan, via e-post till jobb.stockholm@polisen.se senast den 2024-10-04.
   

  

 Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A553.609/2024 i mailets ärendemening.**
**I meddelandefältet kopierar och klistrar du in även följande urvalsfrågor och förklara hur du uppfyller kraven.** 
 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

* Har du gymnasieutbildning, polisexamen eller annan arbetserfarenhet som kan anses relevant för tjänsten?
* Har du god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Har du svenskt medborgarskap?
* Har du akademisk utbildning inom nätverksteknik, systemvetenskap/IT, informationssäkerhet eller relevant utbildning inom IT, cybersäkerhet, högskoleutbildning eller fristående kurser som kan anses relevant för tjänsten?
* Har du dokumenterade programmeringskunskaper, främst Python eller Javascript?
* Har du erfarenhet av OSINT-arbete?
* Har du utredningsvana eller underrättelsearbete hos rättsvårdande myndighet eller motsvarande?
* Är du en van användare av internet och sociala medier samt har god kunskap om internets uppbyggnad och funktionalitet?
* Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med analyseringsverktyg och visualiseringsverktyg?
* Har du vana att hantera stora informationsmängder och visualisera en strukturerad rapport av informationen samt presentera resultatet?
* Har du kunskap om DNS/Internetinfrastruktur?
* Har du kunskap om IP-adresser och IP-adressers betydelse för internet?
* Har du B-körkort?


 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

**Polismyndigheten**
 Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på https://polisen.se/erbjudande
   

  

 Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 www.polisen.se
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansök via e-post

title: COMMERCIAL MANAGER
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
 
 Till vår kund söker vi nu en Commercial Manager som vill leda och utveckla ett dynamiskt team bestående av Commercial Advisors, Software Asset Specialists och IT-inköpare. I denna roll kommer du att ha det övergripande ansvaret för att stödja organisationen i inköpsrelaterade frågor och processer, samt att driva strategiska samarbeten med interna och externa intressenter.
 



 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Leda, coacha och utveckla ett team av Commercial Advisors, Software Asset Specialists och IT-inköpare.
* Ansvara för fakturakontroller, onboarding och offboarding av personal, samt säkerställa korrekt databaselinjering.
* Hantera kontrakt och KPI, genomföra kalkyler och samla in mätvärden och prestationsdata.
* Bygga och upprätthålla starka partnerskap med nyckelintressenter inom företaget.
* Utvärdera och välja leverantörer samt förhandla fram kontraktsvillkor som gynnar företaget.
* Stötta teamen i att driva inköpsprocesser och aktivt övervaka budget och sparmål.


 Kvalifikationer
 * Du har tidigare erfarenhet av roller med liknande arbetsuppgifter.
* Du har starka analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att hantera komplexa kontrakt och KPI:er.
* Du är van att förhandla med externa intressenter.
* Du har erfarenhet av inköp, särskilt inom IT, samt en god förståelse för mjukvaruhantering.
* Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


 Personliga egenskaper
   


 För att lyckas i rollen som Commercial Manager ser vi att du har gedigen erfarenhet inom kommersiell verksamhet och inköp, gärna med inriktning mot IT eller teknik. Du är en naturlig ledare som brinner för att utveckla och inspirera ditt team. Du har god affärsförståelse och är skicklig på att förhandla och skapa starka relationer med både interna och externa intressenter.
   




 Om oss
 
 JobBusters är ett auktoriserat personaluthyrnings- och rekryteringsföretag som är inriktade mot tjänstemän och har funnits sen 2011. Vi på JobBusters bryr oss om våra konsulter och vårt mål är alltid att bygga långsiktiga relationer med både konsult och kund. Vårt mål är alltid att matcha våra kunders drömkandidat med våra kandidaters drömjobb!
 


 När du blir en av oss
   


 Som konsult hos JobBusters kan du känna dig trygg med ett kollektivavtal i ryggen, tillgängliga konsultchefer och engagerade rekryterare. Du som konsult får även tillgång till vårt nätverk av spännande företag och uppdragsgivare! För oss är det viktigt att du som konsult trivs, känner en trygghet och gemenskap till oss som arbetsgivare. Vi erbjuder tjänstepension, löneväxling och möjlighet till flexpension. Du får även tillgång till vår förmånsportal, där du utöver friskvårdsbidrag har tillgång till mängder av rabatter och erbjudanden inom hälsa, hem och fritid, transport, sjukvård och mycket mer! Ditt välmående är av högsta prioritet för oss och vi erbjuder därför dig som anställd Företagshälsovård för att hantera vardagens alla utmaningar, både på jobbet och i privatlivet.
 


 Lön
   


 Enligt överenskommelse.
 


 Tillträde och ansökan
   


 Heltid, kontorstider. Vår kund önskar start omgående och uppdraget förväntas löpa t.o.m. 2025-06-30 med möjlighet till förlängning. Du kommer att vara anställd av JobBusters som konsult hos vår spännande kund. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och i konsultvärlden går processerna oftast snabbt. Rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan (gärna i Word-format).

title: Customer Business Director
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 Mondelez International in Sweden is the home of famous brands such as Marabou. We are now looking for a key senior leadership role within our Commercial organisation. Based from our fantastic site in Upplands Vasby, we are looking for a Customer Director to lead our teams in managing all key accounts across Sweden. Jointly with our marketing and category teams you work with defining, creating and delivering our commercial plans across all channels in Sweden. You are the owner of our commercial G2M strategies and lead our team to create strong crossfuntional partnerships with our customers.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Develop and drive broad customer relationships across all levels with a key focus on building relationships at an appropriate level within the customer
* Define and execute the strategy for the customers and channels
* Lead the key account team to achieve great results
* Ensure the delivery of JCBP (Joint Customer Business Plan)
* Optimize the use of resources in order to obtain more profitability in the operations
* Support in the creation, definition and deployment of plans to maximise growth with in Sweden.
* Be a member of the Swedish Lead Team, reporting to the Country Lead for Sweden


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:
   

  

* In depth experience in Key Account Management, preferably in FMCG
* High level of in managing, leading and coaching teams including leading managers of others
* High strategic ability to understand the big picture and turn insights into actions
* Ability to create & develop long-term customer relationships
* Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills; excellent understanding of business financials
* Deep understanding of the Swedish retail landscape
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required
* A data driven approach and analytical mindset
* Master’s degree within business or other relevant area of study


**More About The Role**
 We are looking for a Customer Director to join our Sales team and lead our teams of Key Account Managers. Our ideal candidate has an ambition towards results-oriented commercial work and the strategic agility to understand the needs of our business and of your customers and channels. As an organization we place high value in having a growth mindset with great drive and the ability to question & challenge the status quo.
   

  

 You will own and develop our sales strategy, planning and execution across all of our customers and channels. You will lead a team of Key Account Managers and it is your responsibility that you and your team together deliver the expected company targets. As a manager you will make sure that your team has the right set of tools & capabilities to develop strong customer relationships and to drive business growth. You will work closely with our category planning & field sales functions to ensure the best implementation of our sales strategy across different categories, channels and in-store environments.
   

  

 Mondelez International is the number one snacking company in the world. This role has responsibility over our diverse portfolio of brands such as Marabou, Daim, Oreo, TUC and Philadelphia.
   

  

**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**
**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Account Management
   

  

 Sales

title: Artist Marketing Manager
description:
The
 **Music Studio** 
 is situated in Stockholm City and is on a mission to become the place where artists and creatives come to realize their visions. The Music Studio is an artist management company and it provides artists with the tools and support they need to be successful and happy.
 







 The Music Studio provides artists with recording facilities, distribution services, artist development, administrative assistance, marketing & promotion, production assistance and artist development.
 







 The Music Studio provides an environment where artists can execute on their creative process in an efficient, satisfying and successful way. Today The Music Studio has employees working with high profile artist projects, and the studio’s ambition over the coming years is at least double the size of the company. More information about the Music Studio is obtained at the next step or request.
 



  





**ROLE DESCRIPTION** 




  





 The
 **Artist Marketing Manager** 
 plays a pivotal role in overseeing and managing all stages of the Music Studio’s artists' music release campaigns—from concept development to final release with excellent skills and understanding of music release schemes/cycles.
 



  





 This position requires a blend of strategic marketing expertise and project management skills to ensure seamless execution at every phase: planning, pre-production, post-production, and distribution.
 



  





 The Artist Marketing Manager is responsible for overseeing both the creative and operational details to guarantee that every release is delivered on time and meets the highest standards.
 



  




* **Artist Relation**
* **Strategy and creative**
* **Project management, budget, agreements and planning**
* **Collaboration and Communication**
* **Relations and networking**
* **Production and activation**



  





**Your Background** 




  





 We believe you have relevant education and approximately 5-7+ years of relevant work experience within Strategy, Marketing/Branding and Production/Project management. As a person you have an entrepreneurial drive and high level of both Creativity and Commercial acumen.
 



  





 More information about the position etc:
 



 http://www.apta.se/artist-marketing-manager---music-studio.html
 



  





**In this recruitment the Music Studio co-operates with APTA. For more information, or for sending your background (incl CV & Cover Letter) , please contact Johan Smith +46709896000 johan.smith@apta.se**

title: Director Analyst, AI Data Analytics for Leadership Expertise (Remote Europe)
description:
**Who you are:**
 Analyst will create Gartner research and analysis, communicate it to clients and support the sales force in new sales and client retention. The research provides insight, predictions and actionable advice to clients in the area of AI, Data Science and Analytics. This includes writing about, presenting and advising organizations about market trends, vendors, service providers, governance and best practices in business analytics.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Conduct research and analysis in AI, Machine Learning, GenAI, Data Science and Analytics. Specific areas of focus will include those topics critical to Data and Analytics Leaders such as Best Practices, AI Ready data, Strategy, Technologies, Market trends and Vendors/Vendor solutions.
* Expertise in:
+ AI/ML MLOPS, model development, management and deployment including infrastructures (SW+HW)
+ Analytics and Data Science
+ Application development implications of AI
+ GenAI
+ AI vendors comparisons
+ Governance and Responsible AI

* Applicable experience in related industry discipline and deep knowledge of a particular market, industry or role; deep understanding of both technology and industry to include the market, vendors, products and user strategies in specific areas.
* Cover the specified areas as well as applicable adjacent areas, while maintaining a view across a broad spectrum of the market, to produce innovative, thought-leading, impactful, fact-based research.
* Identify critical questions facing Gartner clients and crafting appropriate research methods to address them. Provide in-depth analysis based on extensive client input, collaboration with other Gartner analysts and personal experience.
* Drive client demand for Gartner’s research.
* Lead a body of research and be recognized in the industry as a subject matter expert – develop a following.
* Create and deliver high value presentations and other materials.
* Assist the Sales organization in selling and retention on any topic covered by the Analyst's team.
* Provide high quality and timely research peer review. Provide mentorship and support team members.
* Actively participate in or lead research community meetings to discuss research issues and collaborate effectively with peers.


**What you will need:**
* 10+ years of experience within the technology field. Will previously have held a leadership role within technology or business field
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
* Articulate and succinct communication skills; ability to understand and explain complex ideas effectively.
* Exceptional analytical skills: ability to apply conceptual models, recognizing patterns and drawing and defending conclusions.
* Strong project planning and management skills.
* Strong collaboration ethos, influencing and leadership skills.


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 130,000 USD - 165,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:89572
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Test Manager
description:
*Brinner du för att skapa kvalitet och vill utvecklas i en entreprenöriell miljö med spännande uppdrag och kompetenta kollegor? Vi söker dig som vill säkra kvaliteten i våra kunders digitala utveckling, samtidigt som du blir en del av en härlig gemenskap där vi hjälper varandra att växa tillsammans.* 




  





**Om rollen som Senior Testledare** 




 Som testledare på Zington har du en central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder skapa och strukturera arbetet kring test för att säkerställa kvalitativa leveranser. Du driver testprocessen från planering till genomförande till uppföljning. Det kan bland annat inkludera att skapa och genomföra en testplan, koordinera testaktiviteter, identifiera testfall, hantera testdata och rapportera testresultat. Du är spindeln i nätet mellan IT och verksamheten vilket ställer krav på goda ledaregenskaper, teknisk kunskap och förmåga att anpassa din kommunikation efter mottagaren.
 



  





 Hos oss blir du en del av ett team likasinnade kollegor som vill utvecklas tillsammans både professionellt och personligt. Vi delar gärna med oss av vår kompetens och skapar ständigt nya roliga minnen tillsammans. Vill du följa med på vår resa?
 



  





**Dina egenskaper och kompetenser** 



* Minst 7 års erfarenhet av testledning.
* Erfarenhet av olika agila ramverk och metoder.
* Erfarenhet av teststrategier, testprocesser och testmetoder.
* Erfarenhet av olika ärendehanteringssystem och testverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av olika utvecklingsmetoder.
* Mycket god projektledningsförmåga och kommunikationsförmåga.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Meriterande är det om du har erfarenhet från större ERP-projekt.



  





**Mer om rollen** 




 Vi rekryterar löpande och ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt men månar om att hitta rätt person. Därför värderar vi dina personliga egenskaper och att vi trivs ihop högt.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta rekryterande chef Carin Norling på carin.norling@zingtongroup.com, +46 70-209 93 68
 



  





**Om Zington** 




 Zington är ett konsultföretag med expertis inom Management, IT och Design. Vår resa började redan 2008 men idag är vi 250 medarbetare i Stockholm och fler än 4000 kollegor globalt inom VASS koncernen. Vi stöttar kunder som ex. Atrium Ljungberg, Axfood, Apollo och Fora i digital transformation genom att skapa tjänster, bygga lösningar och utforma strategier som driver affären framåt. På Zington ligger vår styrka i våra medarbetare. Oavsett om du är en specialist eller generalist kan vi som konsultföretag erbjuda dig en plats att växa och trivas på. Vi strävar efter att vara en plats där vi stöttar varandra, delar med oss av vår kunskap och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår framgång bygger på engagerade människor – när du växer, växer företag.

title: Controller Non Financial Reporting
description:
Are you passionate about driving positive change in sustainability and work closely with the Headquarter organization? Here at Lindt Nordic, we are looking for a dedicated individual to take ownership in an area of Non Financial Reporting Directive responsibilities which is fast developing.
   

  

 As NFR Controller at Lindt Nordic you are responsible coordinating and implementation a high standard of sustainability reporting and practice required locally but also globally from the Group NFR controller team.
   

  

 The role is newly created entry level position based in Stockholm and will include all our four markets in the Nordics: Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland. The role will be part of an international Finance Team of 10 team members.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities include:**
 Data Collection
   

  

* Coordinate the internal non-financial reporting closings for Budget, Latest Estimates and Actuals.
* Support Data Collectors and Data Validators in the collection & review of relevant data
* Safeguard data submission deadlines for local Subsidiary defined by Group Controlling (defined in Non-Financial Reporting instructions) and adhere to principles set out in the non-financial reporting manual.
* Participate in group audit process if required. In case local audit processes are foreseen, act as first point of contact.
* Follow up on recommendations brought up by the Group / local auditor.
* Participate in non-financial budget and YE-review meetings.


 Reporting Regulations
   

  

* Keep track of latest developments in Reporting standards and local (country) legislations and assess impact on reporting.
* Attend NFR trainings and train the local organization on the training content (“train the trainer”).
* If necessary, inform the Group NFR Champion / NFR Controller about potential group-wide impact.


 Reporting Manual
   

  

* Participate in review rounds of the Non-Financial Reporting Manual and give feedback to the group.
* Participate in yearly update call of changes in the Manual coordinated by the group.
* Train local data collectors & validators as per Group requirements.


 Legal and Compliance
   

  

* Work closely with CFO and HR on topics such as Data Privacy, Anti Bribery & Corruption and ensure accurate reporting is done towards Group Compliance.


 Lindt internal Control System (LICS)
   

  

* In cooperation with Group LICS team and the local dedicated LICS champion, define local application of group-defined standard controls.
* Perform defined LICS controls in line with description stored in BWise. Coordinate the LICS control performance and testing together with the local LICS champion.


**Required Experience And Skills**
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Under 1 to 2 years of work experience with a global FMCG in the any of the following field is a plus: Accounting/Controlling, Internal/External Audit, Non-Financial Reporting
* Critical thinking and analytical skills: ability to identify trends in data and reports and to ‘see the big picture’
* Highly effective collaborator with ability to work and partner cross-functionally and influence without direct authority
* Sense of ownership, entrepreneurial mindset, and independent working behaviour
* Strong commitment to and passion for advancing social and environmental impacts in global value chains
* Curious about sustainability risks, impacts, trends, and best-practices
* Office suite skills, especially Excel. Familiarity with SAP is a plus
* Fluent in verbal and written English


**Personal Characteristics:**
* Excellent attention to detail
* A high level of interpersonal skills and ability to engage, communicate and influence internal and external stakeholders
* Methodical and structured approach to tasks
* With coaching, able to set priorities and clear targets
* High flexibility and adaptability
* Able to grow with the level of responsibilities and with the size and structure of the business


 Lindt is built on true entrepreneurship. This allows the employees to enjoy a high degree of freedom in terms of decision making but at the same time sets high demands on accepting responsibility for the assigned position. It is also fully acknowledged within all parts of the organization that we shape our own future and that this requires an adequate work volume.
   

  

**Does it sound interesting?**
 We hope so! If you're ready to make a meaningful impact and drive sustainability at Lindt Nordic, we encourage you to apply and be a part of our dedicated team. Together, we can create a more sustainable future. You are welcome to submit your application no later than the 27th of September 2024. Interviews are being held ongoing, so please send your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, you are most welcome to contact Katarina Edlund Holmberg, Head of HR, kedlundholmberg@lindt.com.

title: Solution Architect AI
description:
**SOLUTION ARCHITECT AI**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you will make a difference every day? We are looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 In the role as AI architect, you are responsible for designing and implementing AI solutions that will enable our company to grow and enhance our market offerings but as well optimize our internal processes. You will define long-term strategic goals and short-term tactical plans for the AI domain, particularly in the field of Generative AI.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in Generative AI, actively follow open-source project and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
* Support and guide projects with solution design decisions and provide information about impacts and costs.
* Ensure that proposed and existing solutions meet all requirements from the EA framework, with regards to quality, security etc.
* Verify that all contracts with suppliers support the needs of the business, and that all suppliers meet their contractual commitments,
* Support with incident and change management as needed to support our daily operations,
* Adhere to standard Software Validation procedures by collaborating with System Owners, Stakeholders and Compliance Resources.
* Develop and drive the AI strategy, identifying opportunities for AI integration across the organization, defining and driving a roadmap for AI initiatives
* Lead the design and architecture of AI solutions, ensuring that they align with business goals and the Permobil target architecture.
* Ensure alignment of solution designs with architecture and technology strategies.


**Qualifications**
* University degree in IT, engineering or related discipline,
* 2 years or more working as a solution architect or in a similar role or other relevant experience
* Proven experience in AI including Generative AI, Machine Learning and Data Modeling,
* Good knowledge of system development methods and standards,
* Interest in both open-source AI frameworks and libraries as well as closed-source projects,
* Well spoken and written English.


**Who Are You**
 You are goal-oriented, ambitious and see opportunities where others see obstacles. You want to make a difference for others, and you see the value of the connection between your work and the positive impact on others' lives. You seek solutions and are ready to take on a challenge to chase your dreams.
   

  

 You don't necessarily follow the crowd - you find new ways to work and go where you see potential to make your mark.
   

  

**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **June 15th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For additional information about the position, please contact Mats Weckberg, Director Enterprise Architecture, mats.weckberg@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 1600 team members in more than 15 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com

title: Cloud Architect - Data & AI
description:
**About Redeploy Insight**
 At Redeploy Insight, we specialize in building modern cloud data platforms to serve clients across the Nordics to enable enterprise-scale analytical capabilities. Our core focus lies in delivering cutting-edge solutions, including consulting expertise, managed services, and SaaS Data & AI platforms. We take pride in our strategic partnerships with industry leaders such as Microsoft & Databricks, positioning ourselves at the forefront of technological innovation.
   

  

 Redeploy Insight has successfully delivered large-scale and innovative data platforms to Electrolux, Coop, Folksam, PostNord, and Handelsbanken to name a few. Our dedicated team is passionate about enabling enterprise-scale analytical capabilities, empowering our clients to gain profound insights and make informed, impactful decisions.
   

  

 The demand for cloud based analytical platforms is constantly growing and we are now looking for a Cloud Architect specializing in Data & AI to join our growing team in Stockholm. You will work in a fast-paced environment where you will collaborate with some of the most brilliant minds in the field and contribute to the evolution of our platforms with your expertise in Data, AI and Cloud Architecture.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data & AI Cloud Architect, you will work as part of our Architect team helping our clients innovate and improve their business by designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and secure cloud-based solutions for data and artificial intelligence applications.
   

  

 In this role you will be tasked to craft robust and scalable cloud infrastructure solutions, which involves selecting and implementing appropriate cloud services and platforms to effectively support the storage, processing and analysis of large datasets. The role ranges from developing and implementing data architecture strategies to ensure management of structured and unstructured data, to creating solutions for ML model training, evaluation, and inference to ensure that AI applications deliver meaningful insights.
   

  

 You'll be the trusted expert and advisor for our clients and teammates, guiding them through challenges, supporting pre-sale activities and technical delivery. You can expect to work on exciting and different types of projects that will expand your knowledge and understanding across various companies and industries.
   

  

**To be considered for the role, we see that you come with the following experiences and skills:**
* Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field (mathematics, physics, engineering)
* 5+ years of proven experience as a Cloud Architect, encompassing both the design of the architecture from the ground up and implementation with a focus on complex Data Analytics and AI solutions
* Experience in Software Development and/or Data Analytics
* Experience with Apache Spark (Databricks, MS Fabric)
* Strong understanding of ML and AI concepts and frameworks
* Good knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Kubernetes, OpenShift)
* Programming skills in languages such as Python, or Scala
* Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Bicep or Terraform on Azure
* Familiarity with data governance, security and compliance in cloud environments
* Working proficiency in English is required for this role, a plus if you also know Swedish


**And if you come with below experiences, we see it as a great advantage:**
* Certification in Databricks Partner Champion, Professional Data Engineer, Azure DevOps Expert, or Azure Solutions Architect Expert


**Who are you?**
* A person with passion to innovate and design new products and help customers to find best possible solutions to their needs
* A great communicator who can present, visualize and translate complex technical and business scenarios to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Passionate about solving challenging problems in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
* A positive person by nature who have a passion for what you do, putting teamwork and collaboration above all else
* A natural leader who demonstrates an aptitude for leadership, with the ability to guide and inspire team members towards shared goals and clients towards innovation
* Confident in yourself and your own abilities, but also open to learning new things and embracing new challenges


**How To Apply**
 If you're ready to launch your career and make a meaningful impact on organizations through your passion for Data, AI and Cloud Architecture, then don’t hesitate to send in your application by hitting the apply button.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

***Note:** 
 To be eligible for the role you need to be based in Stockholm, or have plans to relocate to to the location.*

title: Emergency Response Team Manager
description:
Nasdaq is looking to recruit an
 **Emergency Response Team (ERT) manager** 
 to the Emergency Response and Operational Compliance team within European Market Operations. This is an extraordinary opportunity to join the world’s leading exchange; growing professionally and intellectually while working in a team of experienced and knowledgeable colleagues in a multifaceted international environment.
   

  

 The Emergency Response Team (ERT) is comprised of a task force of managers and senior operational staff that are mobilized in case of major incidents. We are responsible for business incident management, which involves managing and coordinating the business response to major incidents concerning the markets’ trading and clearing systems and products.
   

  

 The Emergency Response and Operational Compliance team is responsible for the Emergency Response Team function and organization, but also Business Continuity, operational risk and compliance of exchange operations.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
* In this position, you will be focus on business incident management by leading the ERT organization to maintain a high degree of efficiency.
* The ERT area is closely connected to Business Continuity and Crisis Management, in which you are expected to drive European Market Operations activities and interests.
